intro: Popowia gracilis subsp. engleriana, commonly known as the slender popowia, is a flowering plant species native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a hairy texture.
